attributes.action: Divert the £4,000,000 spent on Homeopathy to a Mental Health Awareness Campaign.
attributes.background: Every year, the NHS spends around £4 to £5 million on Homeopathy, a remedial pratice which has been repeatedly examined and found to have no long term health benefit other than placebo. This money could find better use as a national mental health awareness campaign to help curtail MH stigmatisation.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2010 review into homeopathy found that it was a 'placebo treatment'.
http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/science-technology/s-t-homeopathy-inquiry/

This is an example of a mental health campaign which could be better funded with the extra money available from ceasing to fund homeopathy.
http://www.time-to-change.org.uk/

attributes.action: Prior to invoking Article 50 UK Gov should renegotiate EU reform & hold 2nd Ref
attributes.background: The UK Gov to work alongside EU Gov's & the EU Comm to Reform EU Treaties prior to invoking Article 50 and then put a second IN/OUT Referendum to the UK electorate on the basis of delivering material change since the 1st Referendum. This is the pragmatic way forward and will keep the Union intact.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that the UK OUT vote has sent shock waves across Europe and that the Euro Politicians are now coming to terms that they will need to be open to renegotiation and reform whereas previously they were complacent & intransient particularly as they face similar Eurosceptism and calls for similar IN/OUT referendums from their own electorate as things stand. It is time for Europe to reform and it is time for the UK to lead these discussions now that the European elite are in listening mode.

attributes.action: Do not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for five years
attributes.background: While acknowledging that Britain has voted by national referendum to leave the European Union, we the undersigned urge HM Government to withhold from invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for a period of five years from the date of the referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This will provide the best framework for a well-managed British withdrawal from the European Union, promoting national unity, enabling fair and amicable negotiations, and preventing long term damage to the British economy.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking Except in Designated Areas
attributes.background:
There has been lots of scientific research done on passive smoking. It shows that passive smoking is just as bad as actually smoking. When someone is smoking nearby you're breathing in their smoke as well. 
Therefore smoking should be banned outside as well as inside except in designated areas.

attributes.action: Licence and regulate nail technicians, hairdressers and beauticians.
attributes.background: People in the hair and beauty industry are not always qualified or have only done 1 day of training which isnt enough, these uneducated people are working on the public with no knowlage and insurance. They are also causing harm and damage to the public aswell as illegal workers being exploited.
attributes.additional_details: Not being educated in this industry, working on the public and having illness, disabilities, young children and exploitation of illegal workers could cause serious harm to people. Also the people who are working without the correct qualification IS NOT able to obtain any form of insurance meaning they are not covered incase of accident or damage.

attributes.action: Create a bottle deposit scheme for the UK similar to those used in Scandinavia.
attributes.background: The deposit return scheme sees a small deposit (approx. 10p) added to the cost of a drinks container which is refunded when the container is recycled. The impacts in terms of energy costs and CO2 emissions can be considerable. The scheme also helps to reduce littering and it's environmental impacts.
attributes.additional_details: Sweden offers a world-leading example of how to deal with waste from drinks bottles and cans.  The scheme has resulted in recycling rates of more than 90 per cent of its drinks containers. Recycling glass can save 80 per cent of raw materials mined and, with recycled aluminium saving 95 per cent of the energy it takes to make new aluminium. The success of the 5 pence levy on single-use plastic bags proves that these kinds of policies can work well in the UK.

attributes.action: Negotiate safe removal of children and pregnant women from Syrian cities
attributes.background: The situation in Syria, particularly in Eastern Aleppo and other areas under siege, continues to deteriorate beyond what is livable. Attempts at peace have failed. We believe that the United Kingdom must lead the way in providing the safe removal of children and pregnant women from these areas.
attributes.additional_details:
Eastern Aleppo's children's hospital has been bombed. Sick children and babies have no place to receive basic care. Other basic resources, such as food, are running out.

The UK understands the importance of removing women and children from cities being bombed, as this was practised during WWII. The situation is even more dire in Syria. We cannot stand by and do nothing. The UK must lead. We mus act now to save these children.

attributes.action: Make health warnings compulsory on processed meat.
attributes.background: Since the world health authority classified processed meat as class one carcinogen to humans. (Definitely causes cancer.) There should be health warnings placed on all packaging, in the same way the warnings have to be on cigarettes.
attributes.additional_details: Class 1 carcinogen = definitely causes cancer in humans as classified by WHO.

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies increasing prices after a non-fault accident.
attributes.background: Currently, insurers can charge more for customers who have been involved in a non- fault accident in the past 5 years. As an 18 year old, I was involved in one and my insurance costs went up by 20% as a result. I fail to see why people who are not at fault for an accident should be punished for it.

attributes.action: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to even out traffic flow.
attributes.background: Bring back Dartford crossing barriers to limit the amount of traffic going into the tunnel or on the bridge at once. This could help to reduce accidents also.
attributes.additional_details: The fines are not being spent well enough if they have to be in place! Use this money to help improve our traffic flow!

attributes.action: Make schools relax their uniform policies
attributes.background: Schools are turning pupils away due to uniform violations which disrupts a child's education. Schools should be made to relax these draconian policies. A parent is fined for taking their child out in term time, yet schools openly send children home. Clothing does not have a bearing on education!
attributes.additional_details:
Why do schools think it's ok to disrupt a child's education in this way? This denies children the education they are entitled to. The strict uniform policies are often discriminatory and unfair, if not petty.
School uniforms are a part of school life, this is accepted, but why does the 'wrong colour' black shoe or wrong type of material matter?  A child's education should matter more than the cut of their clothing. Make schools relax their policies to ensure all children are treated fairly!

attributes.action: Stop charging NHS staff for parking fees
attributes.background:
Payments are now been increased yearly.  Not adequate parking spaces hence time wasted in mornings looking for spaces.

Other businesses have free parking facilities.

Nursing should not pay to park when saving lives.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for Arts subject tuition, for school age children.
attributes.background: Arts education for young people continues to be subject to yearly cuts. Arts tuition outside of school education is costly, but now necessary to provide sufficient learning opportunities for talented children. This is inaccessible to many families. Help end the elitism and value the arts.
attributes.additional_details:
UK government prioritises "core" subjects (Maths, English, Sciences, Language, History Geography) by way of the EBacc performance measure: http://bit.ly/1QiubcJ  Whereas these subjects should be valued, it's at the expense of arts subjects. 

What is being asked here is a small contribution to arts education, that would actually help boost the economy at the same time. The Warwick Commission estimates the arts sector represents 5% of the British economy valued at £76.9bn: http://bit.ly/1EJWbkV

attributes.action: Create a free fast-track citizenship programme for current resident EU citizens
attributes.background: This petition calls on Parliament to create a fast-track citizenship programme at no cost for all non-native EU citizens who wish to remain in the UK following our exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to 3% GDP as US calls for NATO allies to do more.
attributes.background:
The US accounts for 72% of total spending in NATO. 
President-elect Donald J Trump has called for the remaining members to pay their share, 2% GDP, on defence. 
The UK has an opportunity to lead the way and break through the 2% of GDP, showing Europe that we must take the NATO alliance seriously
attributes.additional_details:
The UK pays in more to defence than any other member of NATO outside of the USA. 
By further increasing our spending to 3%, almost a match to the USA, we solidify our commitment to NATO, showing America that we support the President's call and are the USA's true friend and ally in this matter.
We will show other large NATO nations that they must do more to help the defence of the alliance.
http://www.nato.int/nato_static_fl2014/assets/pdf/pdf_2016_01/20160129_160128-pr-2016-11-eng.pdf

attributes.action: To limit fireworks to organised, licenced events before 9 at night.
attributes.background: I feel that nervous animals, the elderly and young children suffer when fireworks are set off at all hours on any day. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 1  o clock in the morning last night for example.
attributes.additional_details: One of my dogs who had had dental surgery began to bleed again due to her being stressed..repeatedly. People who have to get up early,  young children and the elderly cannot sleep. I'm a nurse who has witnessed elderly dementia patients think they're back in world war 2 because the loud bangs remind them of bombs going off. At least if fireworks were limited to set days and times we could prepare for it better. You can't give animals calming medication continually just in case.

attributes.action: abolish hate crime laws in the UK
attributes.background: A crime is a crime. the motivation for committing the offence should be inconsequential to the sentencing. Labelling an offence as racially, religiously or gender motivated only serves to create an 'us and them' mentality.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months police have been silencing anti  Islam and anti  refugee opinions by labelling them as hate crimes. recently Nottinghamshire police have taken the law into their own hands and have made misogyny a hate crime (but not misandry). This has turned certain groups into protected classes in society.

attributes.action: Have schools teach children the signs of domestic abuse, physical & emotional.
attributes.background: There are too many people who are being abused in their home and we need to make people including young children who may be victims of it aware of the signs so they can go for help if they need to. It will help reduce the amount of deaths each year which go unnoticed.
attributes.additional_details: There are many helpline such as Rising Sun but we need to make sure children and even adults are aware of this as well as aware of the tell tale signs that someone is a victim of abuse, or that they may be a victim.

attributes.action: Make umbilical/placental donation available to mothers all over the UK.
attributes.background: I have 2 children, Jack (17 months), and Alfred who is 5 weeks old.I looked into umbilical donation when I was having Alfie. I was disappointed when I realised this service is only available in 4 hospitals in the UK and therefore would not be an option to me! What a waste of life saving stem cells!
attributes.additional_details: Cord blood and stem cells are used to repair damaged tissue, regrow and replace worn out organs and cure life threatening illnesses, yet umbilical donation is only available in 4 hospitals throughout the UK. Hundreds of thousands umbilical cords and placentas are simply binned and destroyed every year.

attributes.action: Take Military Action against ISIL both here in the UK and abroad.
attributes.background: In light of the recent terrorist attacks in France and Germany, I would call upon the UK Government to take Military Action against ISIL both here in Britain and Abroad.

attributes.action: Make horse riders pick up their horses excrement! Or slap them with a fine!
attributes.background: Why should horse riders get away with leaving massive piles of dump in the middle of the road and down our streets, when dog owners get slapped with a massive fine for a little dump! All pets should be treated with the same rules! No excuses!

attributes.action: Close all faith schools immediately and make a more harmoneous population !.
attributes.background: Our children are the future but in this world of uncertainty and hurt we seem to encourage it by allowing faith schools to propagate . This is wrong and now more than ever ! we need to make certain that our children's future is secure and free from hate and prejudice...
attributes.additional_details: I was educated in a catholic school .... But my mum was a catholic and my dad was a prodestant and neither cared about religion !! Which is how it should be .....I realised early on that we are all the same and at this early age we have the chance to guarantee the same future for our children and our children's children ....but we need to mix all the kids together and let them experience thus for themselves and we need to do it now !!....not tomorrow or the next day but now ...today

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory standards for how MPs communicate with their constituents.
attributes.background: Once an MP is elected, they can ignore their Constituents’ wishes.  Constituents must wait five years before they can do anything about this.  MPs can even ignore Disabled Constituents, or refuse to have email addresses etc. for people to contact them.
attributes.additional_details:
MPs should be required to:-
1)  make contacting them accessible for everyone; and
2)  adhere to basic equality standards.

attributes.action: Move Houses of Parliament to the North of England
attributes.background: Government is considering a multi billion pound refurbishment of the Houses of Parliament. It would seem that now would be an ideal opportunity to relocate from this outdated building and move to a more central location within the UK, near Manchester for example.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit, the development of HS2, the northern powerhouse and other regional investments, a massive project like re-locating the seat of our democracy to the regions would create huge opportunities. Business and industry often follow politics and one would hope that the same could be said if the Houses of Parliament were to re-locate to any of the regions.

attributes.action: Table a UN Security Council resolution on Daesh to end impunity for genocide
attributes.background:
HMG must take decisive steps to: 
1. table a UN SC resolution establishing a commission of experts on genocide and then establishing an ad hoc tribunal; or 
2. table a UN SC resolution referring the situation in Syria and Iraq (as caused by Daesh since 2014) to the International Criminal Court.
attributes.additional_details: Daesh is responsible for genocidal atrocities on minorities, including Christians, Yazidis, and other religious minorities, in the Middle East and beyond. This genocide was recognized by the European Parliament, the Council of Europe, and the US, Australian, and Canadian governments. In April 2016, the House of Commons called upon HMG to take the lead at the UN SC. This steps has not been taken yet and is urgently needed to end impunity and to ensure that justice is served.

attributes.action: Amend the1967 abortion act.No abortion after 24 weeks. Equality for all.
attributes.background:
In the UK it is legal to terminate a pregnancy up untill birth if the child has a disability such as Downs Syndrome. However it is illegal to terminate a child without a disability after 24 weeks.Help me to outlaw disability based abortions.No abortion after 24 weeks. 
#tellitrightstartitright
attributes.additional_details:
Lord Shinkwin’s Bill wants to outlaw abortions on the grounds of disability
If successful, the Abortion (Disability Equality) Bill will remove section 1(1)(d) from the 1967 Abortion Act, which allows for abortion on the grounds of disability up-to-birth. In the UK, disability-selective abortions are currently available right up to the moment of birth whereas in most cases, “healthy” babies cannot be aborted beyond 24 weeks.
#equalityforall
#tellitrightstartitright 
#SaveourDownsydromecommunity

attributes.action: Make the time of paternity leave longer than 2 weeks
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time for a father to bond with their child. In those first weeks skin to skin is so important to establish a bond between parent and child. It also is good to have helping hands after a mother has given birth (including after major surgery).
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2015/05/economist-explains-18

http://national.deseretnews.com/article/2143/10-reasons-dads-should-take-paternity-leave.html

attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well

attributes.action: Make all technical sporting goods in the UK tax free to encourage participation
attributes.background: Cycling has increased in popularity immensely since the success of the 2012 Olympics and due to the Government's cycle to work scheme allowing tax free purchasing of cycle equipment. I would like to see all technical sporting goods to be tax free to encourage more people to take up sport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Olympic success in 2012 and 2016 has shown that the UK has the ability to be a great sporting nation. We should encourage more sporting participation and a healthier lifestyle by allowing tax free purchases on all technical sporting goods and not just for those in full time employment. Clothing would be exempt but hardware would be tax free. E.G bicycles, helmets, running trainers, weight training equipment, trekking poles, climbing equipment etc anything which encourages sporting activity.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 years in prison for possession of indecent photograph of a child
attributes.background: I think it's very shocking that people found in possession of child porn (criminal justice act 1988 section 160) get maximum of 5 years prison. This should be changed straight away and I think personally they should be locked up for life, but I know this ain't realistic for the government.
attributes.additional_details: This is to out of date and should be changed straight away as well as criminal justice act 1978 section 1

attributes.action: Make an allowance for children with social challenges to have term time holiday
attributes.background: Children on the autistic spectrum for instance can find being around others difficult, it can be overwhelming and make them very uncomfortable. They often need more space and time to adjust and process and they ought to have the opportunity for a relaxing holiday, like any one else.
attributes.additional_details: Term time holidays would allow for a quieter environment, more physical and mental space, slower / calmer interactions with people, less stress caused by social situations, less queuing, less waiting, a break from peers, the result being a calmer and more relaxed child and therefore family.

attributes.action: Create a system in which breached child contact orders can be enforced quickly
attributes.background: Parents are being ripped away from their children for months after a separation while they await a court hearing. They spend thousands to get a court order which, if breached, has to be brought to court to be enforced. The wronged parent incurs all costs and is again seperated from his/her children.
attributes.additional_details: The parent breaching the court order is breaking the law yet it is the other parent, and the children, who suffer. It can take 4 months to get a date for the original order to be enforced which is unacceptable. The parent breaching the court order should be forced to pay all costs and this process should take a maximum of, for example, 30 days. This will minimise the emotional impact on the children and parents whilst reducing the occurance of breached orders.

attributes.action: The independent election of the director general of the BBC.
attributes.background: There are numerous cases recently where the journalistic integrity and neutrality of the British Broadcasting Corporation has come into question.  The neutrality of the BBC is essential in order for the British people to make informed decisions regarding Politics in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Permit a one off national holiday celebrating immigrants and their contributions
attributes.background: In light of recent doubts raised across multiple spectrums about the benefits of immigration we believe it is time for immigrants to reveal their true value the country. By staging a single one off strike/national holiday the impact of the U.K. without immigrants might be better understood.

attributes.action: Criminalise politicians and the media for lying, misleading or misinforming.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was the biggest decision in modern history. But the decision made was based on lies, misinformation and speculation. We need an independent body with the power to impose legal repercussions on politicians and media organisations for circulating misleading or untrue claims.
attributes.additional_details:
Gisela Stuart, Boris Johnson and Michael Gove said: 
"After we Vote Leave, there won’t be a sudden change that disrupts the economy." Yet the Brexit vote triggered the biggest fall in the pound in history.
Nigel Farage disowns Vote Leave '£350m for the NHS pledge' hours after EU referendum result. Also, the £350 million figure was deemed 'misleading' (UK Statistics Authority). 
The Sun published "The Queen backs Brexit" - Buckingham Palace complained to IPSO about this claim.

attributes.action: To require a two-thirds majority vote for all referendums in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
A referendum on a national level is meant to be a means for parliament to secure popular consent on issues that leave government divided, or when there is special need for a vote of public support.

This cannot be done when important constitutional changes are decided with a 1-5% majority.
attributes.additional_details:
With turnout in referendums generally falling, the UK needs to adapt it's rules according to voting so that two-thirds majority is required. The UK needs to factor in the fact that turnout will never be 100%, and that 51% of anything less than that is not an actual majority.

A two-thirds majority vote would secure popular consent on every level referendums are held, ensuring that government would have a genuine majority to grant the decision legitimacy regardless of voter turnout.

attributes.action: The UK Government to ask the Nigerian Govt to end sexual abuse of victims of BH
attributes.background:
https://www.naij.com/1065882-how-nigerian-officials-sexually-abuse-and-steal-from-boko-haram-victims.html
Please help me and Bayo Olupohunda @BayoOlupohunda highlight the plight of these forgotten women and children.
attributes.additional_details: There are around 5,000 women and children in Internal Displacement Camps in Nigeria, they have been raped by Boko Haram terrorists and have either escaped or been released and have ended up in the IDP camps, the stigma of having been taken by BH means that many of them can't return to their homes. Corrupt officials in the camps are diverting food and medical supplies and are raping the women and girls too. Haven't these women and girls suffered enough?

attributes.action: A Law to give temp shelter to all rough sleepers if temps are predicted at Zero.
attributes.background:
Put a Law in place, that forces local authorities to give shelter to all rough sleepers should temperatures be predicted at below zero. 
Just today, this guy died on our streets, make it stop
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tragedy-unknown-homeless-man-found-9372526?ICID=FB_mirror_main
attributes.additional_details:
Every year these guys face all weather conditions, and it is not acceptable by any means, there should be a law placed that these guys know that should the weather drop to zero they will be allocated some shelter, should they want it. 
Each local authority should be forced to allocate shelter by the Government, and I ask that a law be put in place to protect those in this difficult situation.

attributes.action: Repeal ALL anti-smoking legislation.
attributes.background: Smoking tobacco is a legal past time, the Government has no legitimate right to restrict a legal activity.  The covering up of cigarettes in shops is ridiculous and counter productive.  Plain packaging does not work.  The high taxation is counter productive and encourages smuggling.

attributes.action: The government to help victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: social services need further training with dealing with women of domestic violence they are quick enough to take children away from women but they are not trained to support women in getting out of these relationship or helping women to be reunited with their children
attributes.additional_details: All cases involving social services and courts should have a expert witness available to explain to everyone the effects and complications of domestically violent relationships also to help everyone understand it. Too many women are just deemed as bad mothers for not being able to escape domestically abusive relationship when there is no support even from social services

attributes.action: Recommission Britannia and give the Queen her boat back - she's earned it!
attributes.background: The Queen has been selfless in her work for this country and the Commonwealth. We took one her great loves away from her and its about time Great Britain and the Commonwealth gave her something back.
attributes.additional_details: This would also benefit Great Britain in its pursuit of international trade deals following its exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Remove the luxury tax on feminine hygiene products once and for all time!
attributes.background: In the UK, flapjacks and crocodile meat are at a 0% VAT rate, yet an essential item for all women is classed under the 'luxury' tax bracket. The so called 'tampon tax' is a ridiculous way of financially victimising women. We the people (signed below) demand an end to this deliberate extortion.

attributes.action: Introduce Apprenticeship's for 30-40 year olds
attributes.background: For 10 years,people born between 1976 &1982 have not been eligible to gain better training for their futures. The "Credit Crunch" forced thousands of workers into unemployment. As an "unskilled worker",an apprenticeship would give work vision and hope for those people who have lost it.

attributes.action: Petition the new New Prime mimister
attributes.background:
The British People demand that When the next Conservative Leader is elected They Sign a Statement of intent Has to when They will invoke Article 50 Before the end of 2016
To reasure the Business World stability And the British Nation
attributes.additional_details:
It is now important that the Goverment 
Stand and deliver on the democratic vote of this nation and come clean on there intentions No more dirty tricks lies and misleading information When will article 50 or Preferably article 72 be signed

attributes.action: Re enact the 1955 canal closure act of parliament.
attributes.background: The Northern reaches of the Lancaster canal were cut off from the main line in 1968.To make way for the M6 motorway,the Locks were de commissioned and the canal was severed in several locations.We propose restoration by stages,to encourage New businesses ,especially tourism.
attributes.additional_details: We have support from numerous boating ,restoration societies.And over 500 members of our group.OWD LANKY BOATERS.Both parish and county councils have show support also.

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: Introduce better regulation for Online & Print Media
attributes.background:
The public rely heavily on media to inform them of the news and make many decisions based on it. It is often biased, incites hate and manipulates people.

This is often evident by reading a number of newspapers, all of which have conflicting articles against each other.

attributes.action: Remove the Barnett Formula from being applied in the UK
attributes.background: The Barnett Formula does not conform with modern equality as it allow some groups to benefit and others not. We should all be subject to the same rules
attributes.additional_details: No evidence is needed as all facts are published by the UK government
